condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan and budget for scaling up of health intervention by 2017

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to work with FMOH and other partners to support the FMOH in the planning and development of the NSHDP (Phase 2) 2016-2020, and supporting 11 states in the development of States Strategic Health Development Plans. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of states with costed implementation plans for maternal, newborn and child health care developed or revised with UNICEF support.

actual.value: 2015:34 States have costed annual operational plans except for, Kwara and Kogi SPHCDA bill signed into law in 23 out of 37 states. Kaduna State has joined Adamawa and Kebbi in implementing one functional PHC per ward providing Ward Minimum Health Care Package.

title.narrative: Number of states that routinely monitor progress on maternal, newborn and child survival against a set of common matrices (using national countdowns, scorecards or related processes) with UNICEF support

actual.value: 2015:37 States. The revised Integrated Supportive Supervision (ISS) guideline and checklist has been finalized, UNICEF will support its use in a few selected states. Ureport is also being used to contribute to monitoring direct beneficiary satisfaction of services which are posted publicly on http://nige

title.narrative: Policies for home visits for newborns (first week of life) developed, revised or implementation monitored with UNICEF support

actual.value: 2015:National newborn policy developed and disseminated in 2014. Implementation is being supported in Adamawa and Kebbi States. Outreaches from health facilities to support post-natal home visits including in hard to reach settlements, by Volunteer Community Mobilizers and ICCM service providers (CORPs).

title.narrative: Weekly regular end user polling report on use of key social services

actual.value: 2015:The U-Report Nigeria is now fully functional with over 1 million U-reporters and participating in weekly polls.
